name: RedgateSqlChangeAutomationRelease
description: Safely deploy database changes with Redgate SQL Change Automation
author: Redgate Software

inputs.name: Operation
inputs.label: Operation

options.DeployFromPackage: Deploy database changes from a build artifact
options.DeployFromResources: Deploy database changes from a release artifact
options.DeployFromDatabase: Deploy database changes from a live database

inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the SQL Change Automation release operation you want to perform

inputs.name: NuGetFile
inputs.label: Database package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the SQL Change Automation build artifact. You can use $(Build.BuildId) or $(Build.BuildNumber) variables to customize it.

inputs.name: ExportPath
inputs.label: Export path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to export the release artifact to. Leave blank if you want it to be automatically determined.

inputs.name: PackagePath
inputs.label: Package path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the SQL Change Automation build artifact that you wish to deploy from. You can use $(Build.BuildId) or $(Build.BuildNumber) variables to customize it.

inputs.name: ImportPath
inputs.label: Deployment resources path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the release artifact to be deployed. This should match the Export path on your Create a database release artifact step.

inputs.name: AppendEnvironment
inputs.label: Append environment name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Append the environment name to the Export path. Use this option to export resources into a unique directory when multiple environments use the same release agent.

inputs.name: SourceDatabaseServer
inputs.label: Source SQL Server instance
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fully qualified SQL Server instance name for the source database.

inputs.name: SourceDatabaseUsername
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SQL Server username used to connect to the source database.

inputs.name: TargetDatabaseServer
inputs.label: Target SQL Server instance
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fully qualified SQL Server instance name for the target database.

inputs.name: TargetDatabaseUsername
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SQL Server username used to connect to the database.

inputs.name: SqlCompareOptions
inputs.label: SQL Compare options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify additional SQL Compare options, or remove default options to be used when generating the update script. Comma separated list, prefix a default option with - to remove it.

inputs.name: QueryBatchTimeout
inputs.label: Query batch timeout (in seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The execution timeout, in seconds, for each batch of queries in the update script. The default value is 30 seconds. A value of zero indicates no execution timeout.

inputs.name: FilterPath
inputs.label: Filter path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to a .scpf filter file. Overrides any existing Filter.scpf file present in the package/source control repository, and is used when creating the update SQL. Filter files can be generated by SQL Source Control and SQL Compare.

inputs.name: TransactionIsolationLevel
inputs.label: Transaction isolation level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Transaction isolation level. The isolation level for the transactions in the update script.

inputs.name: AbortOnWarning
inputs.label: Abort on warning
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this parameter to set the minimum warning level that will cause the release generation operation to abort.

inputs.name: requiredVersionOfDlma
inputs.label: Required version of SQL Change Automation
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default the latest version of SQL Change Automation will be used. If you want to use a specific version you can specify it here.

inputs.name: requiredVersion
inputs.label: Specific version of SQL Change Automation to be used
